page.title: 02Shalford Village Survey
page.content: A questionaire was devised by the {W.I.}(p18-20). About 15% replied and the following picture emerged. Of 100 adults living in 41 houses, 23 are pensioners. There are 30 children under 16. 46 people have paid employment; a small majority working within 15 miles of home. Almost all houses are owner occupied. 34 homes have pets - dogs and cats being most popular. More than half the families have relatives within 15 miles. Only 3 households have no private transport. About half use local buses and a few use trains. Almost all use the{village {shop}but get their main provisions in {Braintree,}going to larger towns for special items. Most people go to {Braintree}to see a doctor. Some go to {Wethersfield}and{Gt Bardfield.}People are sent to hospitals in{Chelmsford, {Colchester,Cambridge,London & B'tree.
